children.subject: I just want to follow up by saying you definitely do not need 126 for 188. I took 188 last semester with 70 as my only college probability experience and things were more than fine. I did take 126 this semester as well and think it could have been nice to have that refresher before taking 188, but would not have made a huge difference. I will say that if you can take both 126 and 188 the same semester, it would be an amazing combo. Both classes complement each other very nicely, with 126 giving you a nicer theoretical background to the concepts covered and 188 giving you more experience putting things in practice to strengthen your understanding.

Thank you both for the advice! In that case, I'll definitely try to take EE126 at some point, given that it'll provide a solid foundation in statistics. Does anyone happen to know if it would be too late to try to take that class for the Spring 2021 semester?

EECS126 would definitely be a good foundation class to take for the ML Path. Based on the HKN path diagram, 126 should actually be taken before CS188 as well. I took it this semester and although people typically talk about its difficulties, I do believe the interesting labs and how much I have been able to learn from this class has been 100% worth it. Also, the curve was very very generous.

history.content:
For context, currently, I am position #71 on the waitlist for CS186 and #353 on the waitlist for CS188. I'm a little nervous about wasting work for those classes if my chances of getting off the waitlist are slim.

1. Given that I am currently declared in another major but am on track to declare Computer Science as a major based on CS70 from the Fall 2020 semester, what are my chances of getting off each of the respective waitlists at this point?

2. In addition, if it worth looking into other classes that I could take for the Spring 2021 semester, what are some worthwhile CS upper division courses I should consider taking that I have a good chance of getting into, having just taken CS70/61C? I'm open to a wide variety of subjects, but realize that a lot of the courses build on one another based on the HKN mapping pathway.

3. Would it be worthwhile to take Stat 134/Prob140/EE126 if I would potentially be interested in going down the ML trajectory? I've taken CS70 and Stat88, so I would just like to avoid unnecessary redundancies but still want a solid foundation. And if it is worth taking one of these courses, what are the benefits to taking one over the other?

Thank you in advance for any advice and Happy Holidays to all!
history.subject: Spring 2021 Schedule Advice
